text: La Virgen entrega la palma a San Julián, Cuenca Cathedral, capilla del Sagrario. Andrés de Vargas (1613–1647) was a Spanish painter. He was born at Cuenca, and came to Madrid as a young man. He studied under Francisco Camilo. He painted religious works for the friaries as well as for private patrons of Madrid. He painted works for the cathedral and churches of Cuenca.William Stirling Maxwell, Annals of the Artists of Spain (J.C. Nimmo, 1891), 877–8. He painted a series of frescoes in the Our Lady of the Sagrario by order of the Chapter of Cuenca. His style was called by Juan Agustín Ceán Bermúdez "feeble," and injurious to his art was Vargas' practice of regulating the quality of his pictures by their price. ==Works== *Transverberación de Santa Teresa (1644) *Martirio del brasero, later at the Museo de la Trinidad *Ascensión de la Magdalena *San Roque (1663), San Miguel church, Cuenca ==Notes== ==Bibliography== *Angulo Íñiguez, Diego, and Pérez Sánchez, Alfonso E.
